results.abstract: Mark Burnett, reality-show producer at NBC, says hopes to use International Space Station orbiting earth for planned reality show, tentatively titled Destination Space (S)
results.snippet: Just because the obsolete Mir space station was crashed into the Pacific Ocean does not mean Mark Burnett and NBC have abandoned their plan to send the winner of another reality-show elimination contest on a Russian-built rocket ride into space.   ...
results.lead_paragraph: Just because the obsolete Mir space station was crashed into the Pacific Ocean does not mean Mark Burnett and NBC have abandoned their plan to send the winner of another reality-show elimination contest on a Russian-built rocket ride into space. Mr. Burnett, still the supreme reality-television producer as the second edition of his ''Survivor'' heads for its finale tomorrow night, said this week's self-financed trip by the millionaire executive Dennis Tito made him hopeful that he would be able to use the International Space Station for his show, now tentatively titled ''Destination Space.''

results.abstract: Interview with rock star Elvis Costello on his recording with mezzo-soprano Anne Sofie von Otter; photos (M)

headline.main: Worlds of Mezzo and Pop Star Meet Somewhere In Between; Elvis Costello: 'Let's Make Music'

results.snippet: However one describes Elvis Costello's collaboration with the mezzo-soprano Anne Sofie von Otter -- or, for that matter, Mr. Costello's work with the songwriter Burt Bacharach, the jazz guitarist Bill Frisell or the Brodsky String Quartet -- it is...
results.lead_paragraph: However one describes Elvis Costello's collaboration with the mezzo-soprano Anne Sofie von Otter -- or, for that matter, Mr. Costello's work with the songwriter Burt Bacharach, the jazz guitarist Bill Frisell or the Brodsky String Quartet -- it is best not to use the word crossover in his presence. He refers to it as ''the dreaded C word,'' and describes the concept as tainted. ''I just say music,'' he said by telephone from his home in Dublin. '' 'Let's make some music together.' It's easier, and less loaded with meaning. 'Let's make some music, and see if anybody likes it.' ''

results.abstract: Home Video column on DVD release of movie Big Trouble in Little China; director John Carpenter comments on 'weird' popularity of his 1986 movie (S)
results.snippet: ''All of a sudden it became kind of this weird favorite,'' said the director John Carpenter. Video can do that for a movie like ''Big Trouble in Little China,'' Mr. Carpenter's 1986 film set in and under the streets of Chinatown in San Francisco....
results.lead_paragraph: ''All of a sudden it became kind of this weird favorite,'' said the director John Carpenter. Video can do that for a movie like ''Big Trouble in Little China,'' Mr. Carpenter's 1986 film set in and under the streets of Chinatown in San Francisco. Some Carpenter films -- ''Halloween,'' for example, and ''Escape From New York'' -- earned reputations in theaters. But others in the 80's -- ''The Thing,'' ''Prince of Darkness'' -- built audiences on tape. ''Home video was cooking then,'' he said. Before the cassette, ''Big Trouble,'' available this week in a DVD special edition from Fox, had problems with many critics and the studio. In those days Fox was run by Barry Diller. ''He treated me O.K., but I don't think he liked the movie,'' Mr. Carpenter said. Kurt Russell stars as a trucker who helps Chinese friends rescue a green-eyed woman from a 2,000-year-old demon who needs to marry her to rule the world. There is much kung fu, but of a style found in films of the 60's and 70's. ''An upscale send-up,'' Walter Goodman wrote in The New York Times. ''Gives good value.''
